author: globo.com
title: 'Pane geral' em TV boxes piratas: como Ã© a soluÃ§Ã£o que promete combater caixinhas irregulares | Tecnologia | G1
text:
1 de 1 TV boxes apreendidas em outubro de 2020, em operaÃ§Ã£o conjunta de PolÃ­cia Civil, PolÃ­cia Federal e Receita Federal â€” Foto: DivulgaÃ§Ã£o TV boxes apreendidas em outubro de 2020, em operaÃ§Ã£o conjunta de PolÃ­cia Civil, PolÃ­cia Federal e Receita Federal â€” Foto: DivulgaÃ§Ã£o
As TV boxes irregulares, que prometem acesso indevido a canais e serviÃ§os de streaming, podem ter uma "pane geral". Ã‰ o que propÃµe um dos vencedores do concurso criado para receber soluÃ§Ãµes para combater essas caixinhas, tambÃ©m conhecidas como IPTVs piratas.
No fim de setembro, o desenvolvedor de sistemas Daniel Lima e outros cinco colegas que trabalham na Ã¡rea da tecnologia da informaÃ§Ã£o ganharam o concurso Hackathon TV Box , organizado pela AgÃªncia Nacional de TelecomunicaÃ§Ãµes ( Anatel ).
O grupo apresentou uma proposta que inutiliza as caixinhas por meio de uma atualizaÃ§Ã£o forÃ§ada . A Anatel disse que estÃ¡ conversando com os participantes do concurso, mas nÃ£o confirmou se vai implementar as ideias.
Hoje, a agÃªncia costuma pedir para as operadoras bloquearem servidores usados pelas caixinhas irregulares. Mas Ã© como enxugar gelo: os endereÃ§os dos servidores na internet sÃ£o atualizados, o que faz as caixinhas voltarem a funcionar.
Por isso, a ideia do grupo de Daniel foi ir alÃ©m do que a Anatel jÃ¡ faz para limitar o uso de aparelhos sem autorizaÃ§Ã£o .
ðŸ‘‰ FUNCIONA ASSIM: a pedido da Anatel, a operadora que receber a tentativa de uma TV box de abrir um servidor pirata pode direcionar o acesso para outro endereÃ§o, em que hÃ¡ um arquivo de atualizaÃ§Ã£o que Ã© baixado automaticamente e pode impedir o funcionamento da caixinha.
"Conseguimos adicionar um cÃ³digo que a inutiliza totalmente", disse Daniel. "Nossa soluÃ§Ã£o utiliza recursos avanÃ§ados de rede para possibilitar que o software da caixinha seja alterado, e o usuÃ¡rio seja impossibilitado de acessar conteÃºdo protegido".
O mÃ©todo Ã© possÃ­vel porque sÃ£o as operadoras (ou ISPs, sigla em inglÃªs para "provedor de serviÃ§os de internet") que administram a comunicaÃ§Ã£o de rede.
"Como a Anatel controla os ISPs, ela consegue obrigÃ¡-los a implementar os recursos avanÃ§ados de rede que tornam possÃ­vel Ã  caixinha receber um pacote alterado", explicou Daniel.
"No momento em que a Anatel implementar a soluÃ§Ã£o, vai ser uma pane geral na maioria das caixinhas irregulares que estÃ£o em uso", disse Daniel.
Para evitar a inutilizaÃ§Ã£o de TV boxes regulares, Ã© necessÃ¡rio definir padrÃµes que afetem somente as caixinhas piratas , como as informaÃ§Ãµes que o prÃ³prio aparelho envia sobre si na comunicaÃ§Ã£o com a internet e os endereÃ§os que ele busca acessar.
O que falta para o plano sair do papel?
O concurso teve a participaÃ§Ã£o de profissionais e estudantes de Ã¡reas como ciberseguranÃ§a, rede e desenvolvimento. AlÃ©m do grupo de Daniel, outras duas equipes foram premiadas pela Anatel.
Agora, com as propostas apresentadas, fica a cargo da prÃ³pria Anatel implementar as soluÃ§Ãµes (ou parte delas). Isso porque trata-se de uma soluÃ§Ã£o de larga escala, que exige a participaÃ§Ã£o de Ã³rgÃ£os pÃºblicos, disse Daniel.
"Para o combate Ã  pirataria, Ã© necessÃ¡ria uma parceria entre todos. Ã‰ um assunto extremamente complexo, que gera bastante prejuÃ­zo financeiro para provedores de internet e provedores de conteÃºdo".
A Anatel informou ao g1 que "tem considerado todos os conceitos e ideais que foram apresentados como melhoria nos processos internos e externos" e que tem feito reuniÃµes com os participantes do hackathon para adaptar as propostas Ã s metodologias jÃ¡ usadas pela agÃªncia (veja a nota abaixo) .
O g1 questionou se as soluÃ§Ãµes vencedoras serÃ£o implementadas e quando isso aconteceria, mas nÃ£o houve resposta da agÃªncia.
Somente em 2023, a Anatel ordenou a derrubada de cerca de 3.900 servidores usados por TV boxes irregulares. Mas a mudanÃ§a constante dos endereÃ§os desses servidores faz o trabalho se tornar permanente para a agÃªncia.
Um dos alvos da Anatel sÃ£o os aplicativos usados em transmissÃµes piratas de futebol . Em uma das operaÃ§Ãµes, o Ã³rgÃ£o bloqueou serviÃ§os ilegais durante a Ãºltima rodada de BrasileirÃ£o de 2023.
Quais sÃ£o os riscos das caixinhas irregulares?
AlÃ©m de distribuÃ­rem conteÃºdo pirata, as caixinhas irregulares podem trazer prejuÃ­zo para usuÃ¡rios. De acordo com a Anatel, os aparelhos nÃ£o tÃªm assistÃªncia tÃ©cnica e nÃ£o garantem seguranÃ§a de dados, o que pode tornÃ¡-los alvo de ciberataques.
A agÃªncia analisou as caixinhas e identificou que algumas podem incluir arquivos maliciosos que assumem o controle do aparelho e capturam dados de usuÃ¡rios, como informaÃ§Ãµes financeiras e arquivos armazenados em outros dispositivos na mesma rede.
Leia a Ã­ntegra do comunicado da Anatel:
"A Anatel estÃ¡ realizando reuniÃµes com os participantes do Hackathon alÃ©m dos premiados, pois todas as equipes apresentaram soluÃ§Ãµes que foram vistas como oportunidade de melhoria no processo realizado pela AgÃªncia. O objetivo das discussÃµes tem sido adaptar as soluÃ§Ãµes apresentadas as metodologias jÃ¡ utilizadas pela AgÃªncia.
Boa parte das propostas estÃ£o alinhadas com o que a Anatel jÃ¡ realiza. Desta forma, a AgÃªncia tem considerado todos os conceitos e ideias que foram apresentados como melhoria nos processos internos e externos da AgÃªncia, que permitirÃ£o otimizar a seguranÃ§a da infraestrutura de telecomunicaÃ§Ãµes e dos usuÃ¡rios.
O processo jÃ¡ estÃ¡ em andamento, pois Ã© contÃ­nuo, com a Anatel trabalhando junto com os participantes."
Relembre abaixo quando a Anatel comeÃ§ou a notificar prestadoras de telefonia para liberarem o acesso ao X:

author: Anonym
title: Plans to attack Cologne Cathedral - Measures for Christmas Eve - The Limited Times
text:
Last updated: 24.12.2023, 00:39
CommentsPrint Share
Police officers and police vehicles are parked in front of the main train station, not far from the cathedral. Â© Vincent Kempf/dpa
With sniffer dogs and a large contingent, the police investigate Cologne Cathedral on the day before Christmas Eve. The reason: the cathedral may be a target for Islamists.
Cologne - Shortly before the Christmas services, the police have increased security measures at Cologne Cathedral because of indications of a possible attack plan by an Islamist group. Police officers searched the cathedral with sniffer dogs and announced that they would check all visitors on Christmas Eve.
In Vienna, too, the police increased their protective measures. According to dpa information, security authorities had indications that a church in Vienna was also a possible target of the group. Previously, the "Bild" had reported.
The police in Cologne wanted to comment on the investigations in general in the morning. At the same time, it was said that the authority would not comment on details because of the ongoing investigation. According to dpa information, the group could possibly have a connection to an offshoot of the terrorist network Islamic State (IS), which calls itself the Islamic State Khorasan Province (ISPK) and has been fighting an armed conflict with the militant Islamist Taliban in Afghanistan for several years.
Cologne police increase protective measures According to "Bild", the first arrests by special forces in Vienna and also one in Germany were made on Saturday. The Directorate of State Security and Intelligence in the Austrian Ministry of the Interior did not want to comment on possible arrests. "We ask for your understanding that we do not comment on current investigations," a spokesman in Vienna said late Saturday evening on request.
The Cologne police had justified the increase in their protective measures with a danger warning, without giving details. The State Security Service, which is active in politically motivated crimes, has begun investigations. Worshippers at Cologne Cathedral and tourists will have to adjust to increased security standards in the coming days.
"Even if the reference refers to New Year's Eve, we will already do everything this evening for the safety of the cathedral visitors on Christmas Eve. In coordination with the security officer of the cathedral chapter, the cathedral will be searched with sniffer dogs after the evening mass and then locked," said the head of the Cologne criminal police, Michael Esser, according to the statement. In the evening, police vehicles drove up in front of Cologne Cathedral, as dpa reporters observed. Police sniffer dogs were also deployed.
Precautions in Vienna A statement from the Vienna police said earlier that security authorities in Austria had increased their protective measures in the face of calls for terrorist attacks against Christian events across Europe, especially on Christmas Eve. Also due to a current risk assessment by the Office for the Protection of the Constitution, there is generally an increased risk situation during the Christmas holidays, the police said. As a precautionary measure, there will be increased surveillance of endangered places in Vienna and in the provinces, including churches and Christmas markets.
My news After shooting down Russian bombers: Putin's soldiers must be tremblingRead
Indications of planned attack on Cologne Cathedral â€“ Police announce special protective measures Read more
Large map of Germany at Christmas: Here people suffer from povertyRead
Tanks unusable in offensive: Russia's army relies on drone strategy in Avdiivka
Cracks in Putin's 'illusion of normality': German ambassador gives insight into life in RussiaRead
"Kleptomaniacs" â€“ Lavrov insults German authorities
Accordingly, civilian and uniformed forces with special equipment and also rifles will be deployed. "Police attention is mainly focused on churches and religious events, especially church services, and Christmas markets," the police said. The terror alert level in Austria is still elevated, the police said. The additional precautionary measures were intended to maintain general safety in Austria, it said.
Since the terrorist attack on Israel by the Islamist Hamas on 7 October, fears have been growing that there could also be attacks in Germany. Dpa

author: VNExplorer
title: Heartbroken family and friends pay tribute to young South Australian firefighter Daniel Page after he suddenly died in his sleep: 'A proper hero'
text:
Daniel 'Pagey' Page died in sleep on TuesdayLieutenant at Salisbury Country Fire Service READ MORE: Firefighter dies while battling Grose Vale house fire
Tributes have flooded in for a much-loved young firefighter who tragically passed away in his sleep.
Daniel â€˜Pageyâ€™ Page, a Lieutenant 2 at Salisbury Country Fire Service branch in South Australia, died on Tuesday â€“ just days before Christmas.
The sad news was shared to Facebook by his workplace two days later, remembering him as â€˜one of Salisburyâ€™s greatsâ€™.
â€˜Daniel, or as we call him â€˜Pageyâ€™, joined Salisbury CFS in 2017 and we knew from day one he would go on to achieve great things,â€™ the post read.
Daniel â€˜Pageyâ€™ Page (pictured) died during his sleep on Tuesday evening, just days before Christmas
â€˜From the stories told, his amazing, kind and empathetic nature has touched many in the service and the patients he cared for as well as saved.â€™
â€˜Pagey always had time for everyone around him and was the first to put his hand up when someone needed help,â€™ it continued.
â€˜His favourite things in life were triple double macchiatos, exploring the countryside with friends and family, working on vehicles or his next project, working incredibly hard to achieve more and being part of SAAS (South Australian Ambulance Service) to help others.â€™
The South Australian man was a Lieutenant 2 at Salisbury Country Fire Service branch and also worked as an Ambulance Officer with the South Australian Ambulance Service
Messages of love and support flowed in the comments section of the tragic Facebook post with many of his co-workers sharing stories about the â€˜specialâ€™ man
The young firefighter was the caretaker for truck 58 and was in the middle of fixing up a leaky master cylinder â€“ which was completed in his honour by a friend.
â€˜You will be forever missed Pagey and the world was a much better place with you in it. Rest easy mate, we will take it from here,â€™ it read.
Working his way up the ranks from Firefighter, to Senior Firefighter and then Lieutenant 2, the much-loved local was also an Ambulance Officer with the South Australian Ambulance Service.
Mr Page was awarded a commendation for his work in evacuating residents of a nursing home on the River Murray during last yearâ€™s floods.
He was also set to receive his National Emergency Medal for his part in fighting the 2019-2020 bushfires.
Mr Page was in the middle of fixing up truck 58â€™s leaky master cylinder which was completed in his honour by a friend
Much-loved and excellent at his job, Mr Page was awarded a commendation for his work in evacuations during last yearâ€™s floods and was set to receive his National Emergency Medal for his part in fighting the 2019-2020 bushfires
Mr Page was an aspiring paramedic and had just been accepted to study at Flinders University.
The post garnered hundreds of reactions and comments with friends, family and locals sending messages of love and support for the South Australian manâ€™s family.
â€˜Only the good die youngâ€¦.RIP, to a proper hero,â€™ one wrote.
Another added: â€˜A truly amazing guy, always had a smile no matter the situation, always providing his crew support and a gentle nudge if needed. He will still be at the front guiding us through danger and looking down as a leader that he was.
â€˜Pagey was special, he always had time for a chat and a laugh, his quick wit, intelligence and people skills set him apart from the rest and his rise through the ranks was not unexpected.â€™
The young firefighter was described as a â€˜truly amazing guyâ€™ and a â€˜proper heroâ€™ for his contributions to the community
A third shared the story of the day he first met Mr Page, writing: â€˜Met him when he came on board as an apprentice â€“ crashed his car the night before his first day at work â€“ still made it in to set a huge impression.
â€˜Grew into a young man, hugely generous with his time, set his goals on some worthy endeavours which speak volumes of him and his family.â€™
â€˜Such a loss to all lucky enough to have spent time with him,â€™ the co-worker added.
Several neighbouring fire stations also offered their condolences, changing the official account profile pictures to the â€˜firefighter downâ€™ emblem.
